title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program where individuals agree to serve as health professionals for at least 2 years in a care scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, individuals must submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to submit an application and sign a contract with the Secretary to participate. Preference is given to applicants with interdisciplinary training. The Secretary will establish a program to recruit individuals for interdisciplinary programs. The Secretary gives preference to applicants with interdisciplinary training for the Loan Repayment Program. Recruitment for interdisciplinary programs focuses on frontline care scarcity areas with demonstrated or planned interdisciplinary health care approaches. Individuals receive written notice upon approval for participation in the program. The Secretary provides written notice to individuals upon approving their participation in the Loan Repayment Program, which includes a contract for student loan repayment. The Secretary offers student loan repayment to individuals who agree to provide frontline care services for at least 2 years in a healthcare facility in a scarcity area. The financial obligations of the United States and the individual are dependent on the availability of funds for loan repayment. The Secretary offers student loan repayment to individuals who agree to provide frontline care services for at least 2 years in a healthcare facility in a scarcity area. The financial obligations of the United States and the individual are dependent on the availability of funds for loan repayment. The amount of annual student loan repayment is determined by the Secretary, taking into consideration the need to pay a sufficient amount. The contract outlines the damages the United States is entitled to for breach and other rights and liabilities. The Secretary determines the amount of annual student loan repayment to recruit healthcare providers. The Secretary can make payments directly to the loan provider on behalf of the individual. If an individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover the owed amount. The United States can recover the total amount paid to an individual under a contract, along with interest, if the individual fails to fulfill their service obligation. Definitions include 'frontline care scarcity area' and 'frontline care services'. The term 'frontline care services' refers to health care services in various fields provided by specific healthcare professionals in shortage areas designated by the State. Authorized appropriations for frontline care services include funding for various healthcare professionals such as general surgeons, optometrists, physical therapists, pharmacists, and radiologic technologists who have completed accredited programs. For fiscal year 2010, $78,000,000 is authorized, and for fiscal year 2011, $93,000,000 is authorized. Authorized appropriations for healthcare professionals include funding for various services. For fiscal years 2010 to 2015, specific amounts are allocated, with subsequent years adjusted based on cost increases. Implementation of the loan repayment program must begin within 180 days of enactment.
